How the US divided Europe to invade Iraq at any cost in 2003
description: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (1/5). In the aftermath of September 11, American neoconservatives made plans to attack Iraq, despite opposition from France and Germany. From then on, to achieve its aims, the White House relied on its allies in Eastern Europe, dividing the European family for years to come.

headline: Renault CEO Luca de Meo unexpectedly resigns, heading to Kering
description: The automaker announced on Sunday, June 15, that its chief executive had decided to step down after five years in the role. His departure will be effective July 15. He is expected to join the luxury conglomerate, which has been facing difficulties.

headline: Is it ever a good idea to... wear sunglasses on the top of your head?
description: In fashion as in life, it's important to know which lines you should not cross. Or at least to do so deliberately.

headline: Israel-Iran: 'This conflict poses a dire threat to the very foundations of human civilization'
description: In an op-ed, prominent Iranian voices including Nobel Peace Prize laureates Narges Mohammadi and Shirin Ebadi and the filmmakers Jafar Panahi and Mohammad Rasoulof argue that the continuation of the nuclear program and the war between the Islamic Republic and Israel serve neither the interests of the Iranian people nor those of humanity.

Was the Trump phenomenon a historical accident? Reinterpreting the history of the American right
description: Convinced that political liberalism was deeply rooted in the US, American historians long downplayed the far right's influence within the conservative movement. In light of new historiography, Trump appears less a historical accident and more the result of a long gestation.

headline: 'Netanyahu called Trump's bluff' by striking Iran
description: In an interview with Le Monde, Kamala Harris's former national security adviser criticizes the concept of 'peace through strength' that underpins current American foreign policy. He also acknowledges the Biden administration's mistakes, particularly in the war in Gaza.

headline: Large crowds gather across the US against Trump, in both joyful and anxious atmosphere: 'We needed to know there were others like us'
description: Demonstrations against the American president's authoritarian drift took place on the same day as the military parade Donald Trump had been wanting to organize since his first term in office.
